channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024010405
item.description:
Report E-2024010405

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: while unloading material noticed a leaking partially frozen open head drum. Drum leaked a small material out of gasket and was promptly cleaned up in house. The drum leaked from the gasket due the freezing and expansion of the drum due to ice formation.

item.title: Report X-2024010413
item.description:
Report X-2024010413

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-23T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO DOOR 160 DUE TO WET HAZMAT PACKAGE. RESPONDER DETERMINED PACKAGE WAS WET WITH RAINWATER, AND BROUGHT BACK TO RESPONDER AREA. UPON DMP PROCESS, NOTICED THAT ITEMS INSIDE HAD LEAKED ALSO, SEPARATE FROM THE RAINWATER DAMAGE. RESPONDER PROCESSED LEAKING HAZMAT.

item.description:
Report E-2024010333

  • City: FAIRLAND

  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver noticed a slow leak from the valve stem, at the bottom of a tote, when making a delivery to a customer. No product left the truck and the small amount that had leaked from the valve stem was contained. The small leak was cleaned up and the valve was fixed.

item.title: Report E-2024010362
item.description:
Report E-2024010362

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-15
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading drum (this was on a pallet with 3 other drums) out of box trailer, a bolt from the open head drum lid caught inside of the trailer and the drum was pulled off the pallet and tipped over into the box trailer. Around 1/2 gallon of material was leaked from the drum gasket. The drum was picked up and the mess was cleaned up promptly in house. No material was released offsite.
